    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell(int positionX,
            int positionY,
            boolean wallNorth,
            boolean wallEast,
            boolean wallSouth,
            boolean wallWest)
        Parameters:
        positionX - int : x coordinate of the cell
        positionY - int : y coordinate of the cell
        wallNorth - boolean : true if there is a wall to the north
        wallEast - boolean : true if there is a wall to the East
        wallSouth - boolean : true if there is a wall to the South
        wallWest - boolean : true if there is a wall to the West

      • Cell

        public Cell(int positionX,
            int positionY)
        Parameters:
        positionX - int : x coordinate of the cell
        positionY - int : y coordinate of the cell Set all walls of this Cell to true.

      • wallToString

        public java.lang.String wallToString()
        Returns:
        String : Return presence of walls as a string of 4 characters. Each characters refer to a wall, if the character is 1, there is a wall. If the Character is 0, there is no wall. Characters refer to walls in this order : North East South West

      • setWallsFromString

        public void setWallsFromString(java.lang.String strWalls)
                        throws SetWallsFromStringNot4CharException,
                               SetWallsFromStringNo0or1Exception
        Initialize walls of this cell from a string of 4 characters composed of 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        strWalls - String of 4 characters. Each characters refer to a wall, if the character is 1, there is a wall. If the Character is 0, there is no wall. Characters refer to walls in this order : North East South West
        Throws:
        SetWallsFromStringNot4CharException - If the length of strWalls != 4
        SetWallsFromStringNo0or1Exception - If a wall have a character not equal to 1 or 0
